author: parchioso
title: Unique and special but not exceptional in overall value
review:
I built this Swamp Speeder tonight, the pricing of this set is quite high for the small size.

The Jedi Commander Barriss Offee minifigure is cool while the other figures are not too special. I just wish I can figure out more on this character.

The Speeder itself has very unique design:
- A side-by-side two seater
- Knob at back that allows you to manuver this speeder like a car (it can turn), there are wheels below but the movement seems to be not very smooth. 
- The bar at the middle looks special but I can't figure out any practical use or playability in it. 
- There are missiles which look nice, but I don't play with missiles anyway
- A propeller that reminds me of my miami trip

I think this set would deserve better rating if the pricing can be lower, due to the unique design and perceived rareness (being a limited edition), I guess it is hot and in demand for that reason, personally I am not too excited on this set, but understand that it should be one that I keep among my Lego collections. 

If you wish to see some pictures (such as how the wheels work at bottom), please check out: http://brickand.me/2010/01/03/Lego8091RepublicSwampSpeederReview.aspx

author: Julius
title: Barris Offee
review:
This set was just in my local store, so had to get it.

The Luminara Unduli - padawan Barris Offee is a top of the line minifig, and the swamp speeder is hugely improved from the one that came with '7260 Wookiee Catamaran', however hardly enough to justify a full set, which is why this set gets a 4 rather than 5.

Pros:
Barris Offee
The front  wheels and blasters rotation via the jet engine on the back
5 minifigs

Cons:
Pricing
The speeder is rather simple

author: joelmama29
title: SWAMP GOLD!
review:
Well I am a big time Star Wars Lego Junkie and I love all the sets that Lego has to offer. What I like about the Star Wars line is that Lego make all of the obscure sets like the Wookie Catamaran, Clone Turbo Tank,  and the Swamp Speeder. When I bought the Wookie Catamaran I just loved the Swamp Speeder and the Clone Troopers with the green markings. 

So when Lego was do rerelease of the swamp speeder I was excited to how Lego could approve on this set. As lego did improve the set they also they also did some disapprovments. 

First the improvements this set do stand out for instance the the set is bigger and more sturdy. The set has a solid construction to it so pieces just do not fall off for any reason. Another big approvement is the flick missiles, on the original set the front missiles would constantly fall off. I also like how the front end turns and in conjuction the back engine turns with as well. 

I also love the little details like two printed yes printed control panels for with control handles. And the final improvement is the wheels yes it rolls. 

But here are the cons and there are a few. The first con is the stickers, stickers drive me crazy! One thing about the older sets that make them so nice is the printed pieces thay come with. I understand it is more cost effective for lego to produce stickers for there sets. But it frustrating to put thos stickers on the sets and get them nice and straight. 

Another con is the price. Thirty bucks for this set is just outrageous even with five mini figs. Again some reason Lego is really raising the prices on these smaller sets. Now I hope Lego does not release the Barriss Offee mini fig in another set to make the price on this worth while. 

I just want to conclude by saying this set is great and worth getting especially if you were not able to buy the Wookie Catamaran set. You do get five mini figs the droids and clone trooper are not special since you can get those in other sets. The Barriss Offee mini is great and original and is a must for any Star Wars Lego collector. If you have the money and that does not bother you diffently get this set before they run out and people will inflate the price on Ebay and Amazon. 


PROS:

Great Obscure set from the Episode 3 
Great Sturdy and Design
Great Detail (Two Printed Pieces)
Barriss Offee Jedi Mini Fig 


Cons:

Stickers 
Same old recycled mini figs 
Price

author: frostlass
title: CHECK OUT THE NEW MINIFIG!
review:
I got very lucky to grab the last one of these speeders at toysrus.I had been waiting to get this, and in my review, you will see the results.

              Minifigs:This set comes with 5 minifigs. It comes with two battle droids, one super battle droid, a clone trooper, and last but not least, beris offee! However, they could of put one more clone trooper in this set and could of made beris's head a little more yellow because it's kind of white. Still, these minifigs would make a great addition to any star wars minifig collection!

              The Speeder:The speeder was the best part of the set to me. The coolest part about this set is if you turn the little fan holder (the thing that the people sit by while riding the ship) the missiles and the front wheels will turn too.The flick fire missiles are kind of hard to flick though because the mechanism I just typed in the review. Though it has cool wheels like the pirate tank and the republic fighter tank except those DON'T have the COOL mechanism that this one does!

The final results:
 structure:9/10
 minifigs:8/10
 playability:9/10

I'd reccommend this set to any lego star wars fan!

author: antjtw
title: Very Nice Litte Set
review:
This set is quite special, many do not recognise this, but I can assure you, it is very special, and I shall tell you why!

I will begin with the Speeder itself, it is small in comparison to other sets of 2010. However, as one little green man once said, size matters not! This set is very sturdy, holding together very well, it is at least 3 times stronger than the old one.  

The wheels underneath help the model to glide along surfaces, mainly tabletop-smoothness, but the wheels aid in the amount of playability; It is now easier to play with on carpet surfaces, thanks to the wheels lifting the models and preventing the model getting stuck to carpet fibres.

The design of the model, like most new models is much better than the original. It looks more streamline and more film-accurate. Including the Bar, running down the middle of the model - which also serves the purpose of keeping the model in-tact. It also includes two seats - to seat The Clone Trooper, whom presumer-ably would operate the speeder. and the other can be used to seat either the Jedi inculded, or another clone trooper, possibly from the clone wars series or an episode 3 trooper from 2005, and summer 2010.

Flick fire missiles have never been a strong point in any Lego set, and I'm afraid it is the same in this set - however, the do look good.

Figures: This set has two, standard, battle droids, similar to all production battle droids from 2007 onwards. It also has a standard Super Battle droid, without the missile launcher from the 2008 AAT set. 

It also includes a phase 2 trooper, more commonly known as an "Episode 3" Trooper, however, It has a new body and back design on the torso of the mini figure, which looks more film-accurate and gives us something new to look at.

It also comes with a new Mini Figure: The Jedi Commander Barriss Offee. Who appears in the Clone Wars Series. (Television). This figure has a blue sabre-blade with a semi-chromed light sabre. This figure also includes a pale-yellow skin tone, which makes a welcome change to Yellow or the common peach skin tone we're used to in the Lego Star Wars Series.

Overall - I recommend you buy this set.

I hope this review has informed you about this set.

author: Superbrick555
title: Fine but not excellent
review:
I do not have much to say for this set  so here is the pros and cons.

 Pros 
Barrais Offie
If you have the clone turbo tank or the at-te it goes great along with that.
Very detailed includes cockpit and controls.
Has shields in the cockpit.

 Cons 
Instead of 2 battle droid there should only be 1 and in its place should be Lamurari Unduli
Not that much fire power.

All and All this set was fine not great so i would recommend to buy it.

author: Carl
title: Watch out Barris cause I think in about two seconds that AT-TE is gonna vaporise you... oh dear
review:
• Pros:
  • Cool

  • Cons
  • Price
The price on this set is kind of ridiculous. I mean, its an average size set with 5 minifigs, i of which is brand new(and awesome) and one of which is a redesigned minifig. so the price sucks. anyways the set rules.

author: David1971
title: Would be quite good if it wasn't so amazingly expensive
review:
Having written the title of my review, "Would be quite good if it wasn't so amazingly expensive", I find that is pretty much all I have to say! It's quite a pleasant little craft, and sturdy. Comes with computers, and seats (it's always nice when the minifigs have chairs to sit on!), and the big fan thing. There are two of what I would call proper minifigs, i.e. the nice new Barriss Offee minifig and a clone trooper. Plus three droids, which I don't get very excited about.

 

At about half the price, it would all seem quite neat. But at £30 (UK) it seems to have broken a Lego record for excessive pricing. Obviously it's all good stuff and the usual great Lego quality, so ... £20 might have seemed ok? But they've got carried away here. Especially since the Lego Star Wars 'battle packs' give you four proper minifigs and a smallish vehicle (and/or something) for only £10.

author: THX_1138
title: Pretty good, but a bit overpriced
review:
This is a fairly good set. Although I never had the original, this looks far better.

Pros:

  • The speeder is fairly accurate.
  • Excellent minifigs, especially for the price: Two battle droids and a super battle droid, as well as a new Phase II Trooper, and a beautiful Bariss Offee figure!
  • The speeder's wheels work pretty well, and are hard to see.
  • The speeder contains a really cool mechanism that moves the engine if the front wheel are turned.
Cons:

  • The price is a bit high for the number of parts.
  • The speeder has flick-fire missiles, although these stay in pretty well.
  • The shape and size of the speeder aren't quite accurate.
  • The speeder has lots of stickers, without which it wouldn't look nearly as good.
I would recommend this set, especially if you can get on on sale.

author: GameMasterForever
title: Pricey and a Little Old!
review:
I feel that this set is a little pricey and that it is very expensive for a set that has about 250 pieces. I was really excited upon getting this set since it has Barriss Offee. I already missed out on Luminara Unduli so why not get it.

Pros:
  • Barriss Offee and new redesigned Clone Trooper
  • Nice and small so doesn't take up too much room on my shelf.
Cons:
  • Very Expensive
  • Stickers
This might be a good idea. They should make a Clone Wars version of the battle droid. Well... I don't think that it will ever really appear since Lego Star Wars ends soon. But oh well... must enjoy what we have now.

author: cheeseballs
title: Pretty good set in all
review:
Okay, let me preface this by first saying that this overall a great set. I think that there are some aspects of this set that Lego should work on. I mean you can get a much better deal for your money for the pieces. It is 176 pieces for $30. You can get a better deal with the Freeco speeder. Anyway... 
The minifigures are great because a super battle droid and two battle droids doesn't hurt. Plus the new armor on the clone is awesome and Barris is also awesome because of her rare lego skin tone. The clone has more detail on his armor and also stronger detail with more bold black lines. So I would say the minifigs are great.
On to the actual speeder. Well first let me say that it is a lot better than the 2005 model. From the detailed control panels, the engine turbine in the back, the joysticks, and the shifting wheels it is a lot better. To me the only real problem is that the wheels have virtually no traction at all. I mean if you're rolling it on the rug it is okay, it still slides a bit. But my house is mostly hardwood floors so it just slides away when you push or turn it. The wheels are just those smooth plastic one that are even used for a couple of the engines on the Venator. Lego could have put in smaller rubber wheels. SO... let me review all of this and write a pros and cons list.
  • Pros:
  • - 5 minifigs
  • - Barris Offee
  • - New clone trooper
  • - Control panels
  • - fun to build
  • - cool engine turbine
  • Cons:
  • - Horrible piece/price ratio
  • - Bad wheel traction
I guess that it is a pretty good set in general, and any Lego Star Wars lover should definitely buy it.

author: Mageamooney
title: My 3rd Speeder Review... "3rd time lucky" they say... this is the best yet!
review:
The Republic Swamp Speeder is a brilliant Clone Wars set, that has a great rare minifig (see below) and is a great all-round set.

Pros:

  • Bariss Offee!
  • Hidden wheels for a great "hovering" look,
  • Very accurate
  • Great new flick-firing missiles.

Cons:

  • Slightly overpriced

Summary:

The Swamp Speeder is a fantastic Star Wars set, with some great minifigs, and I would definatly recommend it to any Star Wars fan, even if you don't like the Clone Wars TV series.

author: desire4one
title: Let the Swamp Speeder pass on by...
review:
The Republic Swamp Speeder was one of those tend-hype buys.  I hadn't seen it, but I knew it was out.  There was a lot of buzz about it, so when I found it, I snatched it up (along with Dooku's Star Sailor).  I had my reservations and I should have listened to them.  I was completely disappointed with this set.

The parts are average at best.  I found that only the shield/barrier pieces and the propeller had any use worthwhile use outside the set.  Everything else was more of the same, in a very bland way.

The minifigs are nothing to write home about.  In fact, the only real reason to buy the set is for Barriss Offee, but to put it in perspective, your paying $30 for one worthwhile figure.  If your like me, that just doesn't sit well in your budget.

Pros:

  • Barriss Offee.  Pretty much it.
  • 3-4 worthwhile part pieces. 

Cons:

  • Generally speaking, a small set.
  • Same old, same old, from the pieces to the Battle Droids.
  • This set is priced at $30.  In reality no one should pay more than $15 for it.

Bottom line:  Unless your a huge Barriss fan, stay away.

author: redsoxfan1997
title: Swamp Epicness
review: This set is one of myfavorite sets of all-time. It has wheels to make it veryeasyto slide along a flat surface, but the minifigs won't sit in the chairs very well. I have 2 at the moment and may get one or two more. I recomend this set to anyone wholikes Star Wars.

author: oldlegosback
title: Republic Swamp Speeder is so cool
review:
I got this set at toysrus for 29.99 and I must say this is a cool set and it is a limited edition set so they won't be out for that long.

            PROS:

  • CON:

I will agree with everybody that this is a little over price because this set  has 176 pcs/pzs and comparing to Hyena Droid Bomber that has 232 pcs/pzs for 20.00 dollars and Droid Tri-Fighter with 269 pcs/pzs for 25.00 dollars.Overall this is a great set and I will recommend this to every lego star wars fan.
Keep Up The Great Work Lego :)

author: gordi99
title: new clonetrooper!
review:
HI, this is an awsome set! A bit overpriced, but still very good. This speeder is much better then the first one.

                pros:

  •                       not a fan of the flick-fire missles

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: The Price Tag Unleashed! Part Deux.
review:
maaboo35's Note: If you don't get the title, see my Rogue Shadow review.

Okay! Let's get to the review. What we have here is a Republic Infantry Support Platform... okay, okay, Swamp Speeder. It's a little speeder with laser cannons and a little turbofan that acts like one of those airboats you see in the Everglades - but piloted by a clone. It's a cool concept, right?
 

Yeah, basically. I personally like this model very much, and it's a joy to build. Being a smaller model, it's not too demanding, but not overly simple either. The steering mechanism for the speeder is inventive and well implemented, and uses quite a few Technic parts. It's easy to use, and the cannons have some very cool-looking barrels. Two of the speeder's contols panels are ACTUAL transfers, and hopefully spell the end for the overuse of stickers in sets.
 

The figures that come with the set are nothing short of impressive, either! Okay, the droids... we've seen them a bit often and they're nothing new. But the new Clone Trooper and Jedi Barriss Offee? Now this is more like it! Barriss is a new figure, making her debut in this set, and she's an excellent addition to anyone's collection, as she's very detailed and true to her appearance in the Star Wars franchise. Ever wanted to recreate the Medstar Duology? Not a geek? Okay, fine.

While the set is pretty good in principle, the is one MASSIVELY defining flaw.

The PRICE.

By. The. Force.

£39.99 Sterling, which is what I paid. It's enough to make you turn to the Dark Side. This is possibly the worst price to piece ratio ever. Yes, Barriss Offee and her Trooper are great, but... they just don't warrant that kind of price. They just don't. I've seen cheaper Faberge eggs.
 

Also, the stickers present in the set are a pain the the rear. They're just not staying on. 

Whoa. Sorry.

Even after that rant, I still feel the set is great. It's just not really worth the price being asked. If you're okay with handing over a wad - a BIG wad - for a neat little vehicle for your ground fleet, get this. More cash-strapped fans are better off getting something else.

author: spacewars30
title: I have some advice for the lego company......MAKE THINGS CHEAPER!
review:
Even though this was a pretty good set overall, it's a huge rip-off! $32.99 for 176 pcs! Some cheaper sets have over 50 more pieces than this. Other than the price, it's a 4/5. It comes with Baris Offee, 1 clone trooper (old fashioned helmet), a super battle droid, and 2 battle droids. The minifigs are great! The speeder itself is pretty good, nothing special. A typical speeder. I think it could have been much bigger for its price.

 

Pros:

Baris Offee

Clone Trooper has old fashioned helmet

Cool speeder design

 

Cons:

Way overpriced

A little too small

Not enough droids

author: stamahawk13
title: Needed to be $20 cheaper.
review:
I bought this set on sale about a month ago, and after I had completed the very short build I was still annoyed at how much I payed for the small speeder. The speeder looks great, and comes with perfectly detailed minifigures. The swamp speeder could have been a brilliant set if it wasn't wrecked by the expensive price.
'pros'
minifigures
lots of playability
detail on swamp speeder
good to see another pack containing an ep.3 clone
detail on both control panels
can fit about 4 minifigures sitting at the back of the speeder 
'cons'
price
no clone swamp troopers

author: LEGOSLUG
title: Destroy all Droids with the new Republic Swamp Speeder!
review:
Here's my review of the set LEGO Star Wars 8091 Republic Swamp Speeder.
This set is a Special Edition Set, and rarer now.

The Minifigures:

* Battle Droid - Beige.
* Battle Droid - Beige.
* Super Battle Droid - Dark Grey.
* Clone Trooper - Phase 2 Armour, New Design Torso.
* Barris Offee - Black Hood, Black Cape, Blue Lightsaber.

The Build:

The build will take about 20 Mins to complete. In this version of the Republic Swamp Speeder, it has a turning mechanism on the underside that controls the rear turbofan, the steering wheels, and the flick-fire missiles. The use of this mechanism improves the set play, and also lifts the set up as if it were hovering.

A good use of parts are here too, the curves are used to great effect on the front and back. These parts are good for MOC's, and Custom Creations. The spare parts are god as well, some extra battle droid arms, extra lever and 'light' red 1X1 "dot".

Now, On to the Pros and Cons.

Pros:

* New Barris Offee Minifigure.
* New Design torso on the Clone Trooper.
* Great selection of parts.
* You can stage a battle with 2 types of Minifig's.

Cons:

* Barris Offee's minifig hands get 'wobbly' easily.
* Overpriced.
* STICKERS!

Conclusion:

It's great. Get it. This Special Edition Set is better than past ones, and with the selection of parts, minifigures and techniques used, it's worthwhile. The finished set looks, sleek, and definitely has that Star Wars Authenticity that we crave. 5/5.

LEGOSLUG
P.S. Please see my other reviews and bricklists.

author: FanofLego
title: A pretty good lego star wars set
review: This set was not bad. I liked the new clone but it should have come with a swamp clone or kashyyyk trooper. The box makes it look so much bigger than it actually is. It can serve well if you're playing a battle sequence but after a month you tend to forget about it. I wouldn't necessarily reccomend it to lego star wars fans, but if you do get the set you shoudn't be too disappointed. Offee looked good but I don't think she goes well with this set. Offee should be placed in a Clone Wars set with Luminara. I was not a huge fan with how the guns turn in the opposite direction you turn in. If you were turning it in real life you would want your guns pointed on where you're turning not in the other direction. But it needed something technical to show on the back of the box because lego boxes such as the atlantis angler fish look really silly when the front and back of the box are showing the same thing twice just from a little bit different perspective. Well overall I'd rate this set as decent because it's not often you get a set from the actual saga these days.

author: The_Reviewer
title: Very overpriced
review:
There is one major flaw in this set;and that is the price:29.99 USD is way to much! The speeder has small hidden wheels underneath,a turning function to by turning the turbine.But,the wierd thing is how the ship's guns are the missiles,sow it's like losing your guns after you fire your missiles.

Box/Instructions

Basic,normal,and nothing special

Parts

Minifigures

5 Barris Offee is new and exclusive,the Clone Trooper has new printing(better than the LAME clone war ones).A Super battle driod and two typical battle driods(My favorite minifig in this set is Barris Offee)

The build

Very easy,nothing Challenging

The completed model

Kinda small (in fact much smaller than youd think)

Summary

This set may be overpriced and very small,but I wish it had 2 Swamp speeder troopers like in the Wookie Cataram Set instead of common battle droids.If you want my advice buy this only when it is on sale;it should be 14.99 not 29.99

author: trooper123
title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY!£
review:
The best part of the set is the playabillty but (not worth the money should be £20.00 not £35.00)

Figures,

They are the same droids i think they are quite boring but the super battle droid is very good it has one rocket lurncher hand and one blaster hand,the legs of the super battle droid are the same as the normal droids just gray.

thanks for reading!

author: Blockland
title: Rehashing done right
review:
Many people will claim that rehashing is just a lazy form of trying to make more money, which is what 75 percent of the video game market does. However, it is sometimes done right, by updating some features or including brand new content. I believe I bought this set in 2011, mostly because I had enjoyed the original version back in 2005. Looking at the 2 side by side, you could almost be tempted to call this a simple color change, and with a brand new Jedi. Despite my hatred towards Lego releasing old sets with a few new pieces and a largely f***ed up price, this is one exception to that rule. The box is nothing special, other than the exclusive logo on the bottom right hand corner. I believe it was split into 2 parts, then again, this was 2 years ago. The Minifigures are quite nice. You can almost never have enough B1 and B2 battle droids. Also the updated episode 3 clone is spot on, and does a much better job than the ones found in the 2014 battle packs... assuming you're reading this after they've been released. I'm not too knowledgeable on the newest clone wars series, but I believe Barris was a padawan who was trapped in a light saber crystal cave back in the original 2003 clone wars version. Lego did a fairly nice job, however, I would have preferred another clone trooper, possibly even a Star Corps clone. The Speeder itself is slightly bigger than the original, and features a moving turret system that is in lined with the speeders movement. Overall, the speeder has been completely updates, even the guns were remodeled. However, there is one concern. The original speeder came with a Wookie catamaran, which was huge, and was only at about 50$. You are looking at 30$ here, and that is just the original retail price. Another clone would have been nice.

Pros

  • Great design and update
  • Good Minifigures
  • Updated movement system
  • Fun build
  • A great array of parts

Cons

  • Quite Pricy
  • Another clone would have justified the cost

Not a bad set at all, and if you can find one that is under 35$, I suggest you buy it.

author: LegoHov23
title: Good, Although A Bit Expensive
review:
I like the Clone Wars clones but I adore the Phase 2 clone troopers so I immediately decided that I had to pickup this set when I saw it in stores. Eventually I managed to grab it (the last one left!), and despite the fairly hefty price it was a worthy buy.

Pros

  • Phase 2 clone trooper; I can't get enough of them, especially since I have very few
  • Barris Offee; good to have another Jedi and the cape and hood are nice
  • Moar droids
  • The speeder itself is pleasant to look at
  • Nice little seats on the speeder with computers and levers
  • To turn the speeder you just twist the engine on the back

Cons

  • Costly; it's not a big set and Barris Offee isn't worth that much
  • Maybe instead of Offee they could've included another clone - could that have lowered the price?
Overall, a good set but it is costly; seems to be a bit of a trend with Star Wars LEGO. Still, the figures are good (that clone...) and the speeder itself is nice to look at and a good addition to your Republic army. If you can find it cheap, get it. If not.... Think about, because it is a pretty sweet set.

author: SmythTheCrow
title: This Swamp Speeder is cool!!!!1!!11
review:
This is the review on the Limited Edition Republic Swamp Speeder.

This set came out back in 2010 and it is rare now.

PROS:

-Barris Offee and Clone Trooper minifigures.

-Great Playability

-Great Selection of Parts

-Easy to build

 

CONS:

-The Price(duh!)

-No Swamp Troopers

-STICKERS!!!!!1!!

 

Overall:

8/10.      Hope u enjoyed. 

-MasterAS

author: Tar_Domo
title: Army builder set, "A Bigger Battle Pack"
review:
I bought this just a week ago and paid 37€ for it. I wasn´t going to get this as a must-have, but when I found it I decided to take it.

Box/Instructions

This comes in a bigger box than the normal 35€ sets. The instructions were easy to follow.

Parts

This contains 176 parts and I feel that a little bit too less when I compare it to its price. But, you get great minifigures so it´s not such a big problem. It has some interesting parts and also stickers.

Minifigures

This comes with 5 minifigures.

Battle droid x2: Nice standard army builders

Super battle droid: Brings some heavy firepower to the battle on the droid side

Clone Trooper: Good Phase II army builder

Barriss Offee: Choose this or the one from Geonosian Cannon. If you like black, pick this and if you like blue more then just pick the other if Barriss is your reason to buy this set.

The build

I had no problems, I think and the building was overall easy and fast.

The completed model

Some parts are dropping and the model is a little small when compared to the price but it is a good swamp speeder and bigger than the swamp speeder from Kashyyyk Troopers.

Overall opinion

I recommend to pick this if you find it as an interesting set with the price less than 40€. Now Amazon.com sells it with price  37$ and in Ebay it´s avaible in 15€/20$.
